pull.title: Add linter: Enforce the source code file naming convention described in the developer notes
pull.body: Add linter: Enforce the source code file naming convention described in the developer notes.

events.message: Add linter: Enforce the source code file naming convention described in the developer notes

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
Fix incorrect shell quoting in FreeBSD build instructions.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13476

Add linter: Enforce the source code file naming convention described in the developer notes
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13450

Document validationinterace callback blocking deadlock potential.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13402

scripted-diff: Avoid temporary copies when looping over std::map
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13241

Avoid concurrency issue when make multiple target
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13465

contrib: Fix CVE-2018-12356 by hardening the regex
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13479

Add linter: Make sure we explicitly open all text files using UTF-8 encoding in Python
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13448

Docs: Improve readability of "Squashing commits"
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13488

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+#
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+#
+# Make sure only lowercase alphanumerics (a-z0-9), underscores (_) and
+# hyphens (-) are used in source code filenames.
+
+EXIT_CODE=0
+OUTPUT=$(git ls-files -- "*.cpp" "*.h" | grep -vE '^[a-z0-9_./-]+$' | grep -vE 'src/(secp256k1|univalue)/')
comments.body:
Just noting that this regex doesn't work for me: [a-z] also covers [A-Z]

```
$ echo 'A'|grep -E '[a-z]'
A

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+#
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+#
+# Make sure only lowercase alphanumerics (a-z0-9), underscores (_) and
+# hyphens (-) are used in source code filenames.
+
+EXIT_CODE=0
+OUTPUT=$(git ls-files -- "*.cpp" "*.h" | grep -vE '^[a-z0-9_./-]+$' | grep -vE 'src/(secp256k1|univalue)/')
comments.body:
Oh, good catch  that is probably yet another case of locale dependence!

* What are your locale settings (`LANG`, `LC_ALL`, etc.)? Output from `set | grep -E '^(LANG|LC_)'` would be helpful.
* What version of `bash` are you using?
* What is the output of `shopt | grep globasciiranges`?
* What OS version are you using?

`echo 'A' | LC_ALL=C grep -E '[a-z]'` works as expected, right?

Now updated with `LC_ALL=C`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+#
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+#
+# Make sure only lowercase alphanumerics (a-z0-9), underscores (_) and
+# hyphens (-) are used in source code filenames.
+
+EXIT_CODE=0
+OUTPUT=$(git ls-files -- "*.cpp" "*.h" | grep -vE '^[a-z0-9_./-]+$' | grep -vE 'src/(secp256k1|univalue)/')
comments.body:
`echo 'A' | LC_ALL=C grep -E '[a-z]'` works now.


```sh
$ set | grep -E '^(LANG|LC_)' && bash --version | head -1 && shopt | grep globasciiranges && lsb_release -d
LANG=en_US.UTF-8
GNU bash, version 4.4.19(1)-release (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu)
globasciiranges	off
Description:	Fedora release 28 (Twenty Eight)
